1863         (!Type.isNumber(parents[1]) && !Type.isFunction(parents[1]))
1864     ) {
1865         throw new Error(
1866             "JSXGraph: JXG.createCardinalSpline: argument 2 'tau' has to be number between [0,1] or function'" +
1867                 errStr
1868         );
1869     }
1870     if (!Type.exists(parents[2]) || !Type.isString(parents[2])) {
1871         throw new Error(
1872             "JSXGraph: JXG.createCardinalSpline: argument 3 'type' has to be string 'uniform' or 'centripetal'" +
1873                 errStr
1874         );
1875     }
1876 
1877     attributes = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, "curve");
1878     attributes = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, "cardinalspline");
1879     attributes.curvetype = "parameter";
1880 
1881     p = parents[0];
1882     q = [];
1883 
1884     // given as [x[], y[]]
1885     if (
1886         !attributes.isarrayofcoordinates &&
1887         p.length === 2 &&
1888         Type.isArray(p[0]) &&
1889         Type.isArray(p[1]) &&
1890         p[0].length === p[1].length
1891     ) {
1892         for (i = 0; i < p[0].length; i++) {
1893             q[i] = [];
1894             if (Type.isFunction(p[0][i])) {
1895                 q[i].push(p[0][i]());
1896             } else {
1897                 q[i].push(p[0][i]);
1898             }
1899 
1900             if (Type.isFunction(p[1][i])) {
1901                 q[i].push(p[1][i]());
1902             } else {
1903                 q[i].push(p[1][i]);
1904             }
1905         }
1906     } else {
1907         // given as [[x0, y0], [x1, y1], point, ...]
1908         for (i = 0; i < p.length; i++) {
1909             if (Type.isString(p[i])) {
1910                 q.push(board.select(p[i]));
1911             } else if (Type.isPoint(p[i])) {
1912                 q.push(p[i]);
1913                 // given as [[x0,y0], [x1, y2], ...]
1914             } else if (Type.isArray(p[i]) && p[i].length === 2) {
1915                 q[i] = [];
1916                 if (Type.isFunction(p[i][0])) {
1917                     q[i].push(p[i][0]());
1918                 } else {
1919                     q[i].push(p[i][0]);
1920                 }
1921 
1922                 if (Type.isFunction(p[i][1])) {
1923                     q[i].push(p[i][1]());
1924                 } else {
1925                     q[i].push(p[i][1]);
1926                 }
1927             } else if (Type.isFunction(p[i]) && p[i]().length === 2) {
1928                 q.push(parents[i]());
1929             }
1930         }
1931     }
1932 
1933     if (attributes.createpoints === true) {
1934         points = Type.providePoints(board, q, attributes, "cardinalspline", ["points"]);
1935     } else {
1936         points = [];
1937 
1938         /**
1939          * @ignore
1940          */
1941         getPointLike = function (ii) {
1942             return {
1943                 X: function () {
1944                     return q[ii][0];
1945                 },
1946                 Y: function () {
1947                     return q[ii][1];
1948                 },
1949                 Dist: function (p) {
1950                     var dx = this.X() - p.X(),
1951                         dy = this.Y() - p.Y();
1952                     return Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy);
1953                 }
1954             };
1955         };
1956 
1957         for (i = 0; i < q.length; i++) {
1958             if (Type.isPoint(q[i])) {
1959                 points.push(q[i]);
1960             } else {
1961                 points.push(getPointLike(i));
1962             }
1963         }
1964     }
1965 
1966     tau = parents[1];
1967     type = parents[2];
1968 
1969     splineArr = ["x"].concat(Numerics.CardinalSpline(points, tau, type));
1970 
1971     el = new JXG.Curve(board, splineArr, attributes);
1972     le = points.length;
1973     el.setParents(points);
1974     for (i = 0; i < le; i++) {
1975         p = points[i];
1976         if (Type.isPoint(p)) {
1977             if (Type.exists(p._is_new)) {
1978                 el.addChild(p);
1979                 delete p._is_new;
1980             } else {
1981                 p.addChild(el);
1982             }
1983         }
1984     }
1985     el.elType = "cardinalspline";
1986 
1987     return el;
1988 };
1989 
1990 /**
1991  * Register the element type cardinalspline at JSXGraph
1992  * @private
1993  */
1994 JXG.registerElement("cardinalspline", JXG.createCardinalSpline);
1995 
1996 /**
1997  * @class This element is used to provide a constructor for metapost spline curves.
1998  * Create a dynamic metapost spline interpolated curve given by sample points p_1 to p_n.
1999  * @pseudo
2000  * @description
2001  * @name Metapostspline
2002  * @augments JXG.Curve
2003  * @constructor
2004  * @type JXG.Curve
2005  * @param {JXG.Board} board Reference to the board the metapost spline is drawn on.
2006  * @param {Array} parents Array with two entries.
2007  * <p>
2008  *   First entry: Array of points the spline interpolates. This can be
2009  *   <ul>
2010  *   <li> an array of JSXGraph points</li>
2011  *   <li> an object of coordinate pairs</li>
2012  *   <li> an array of functions returning coordinate pairs</li>
2013  *   <li> an array consisting of an array with x-coordinates and an array of y-coordinates</li>
2014  *   </ul>
2015  *   All individual entries of coordinates arrays may be numbers or functions returning numbers.
2016  *   <p>
2017  *   Second entry: JavaScript object containing the control values like tension, direction, curl.
2018  * @param {Object} attributes Define color, width, ... of the metapost spline
2019  * @returns {JXG.Curve} Returns reference to an object of type JXG.Curve.
2020  * @see JXG.Curve
2021  * @example
2022  *     var po = [],
2023  *         attr = {
2024  *             size: 5,
2025  *             color: 'red'
2026  *         },
2027  *         controls;
2028  *
2029  *     var tension = board.create('slider', [[-3, 6], [3, 6], [0, 1, 20]], {name: 'tension'});
2030  *     var curl = board.create('slider', [[-3, 5], [3, 5], [0, 1, 30]], {name: 'curl A, D'});
2031  *     var dir = board.create('slider', [[-3, 4], [3, 4], [-180, 0, 180]], {name: 'direction B'});
2032  *
2033  *     po.push(board.create('point', [-3, -3]));
2034  *     po.push(board.create('point', [0, -3]));
2035  *     po.push(board.create('point', [4, -5]));
2036  *     po.push(board.create('point', [6, -2]));
2037  *
2038  *     var controls = {
2039  *         tension: function() {return tension.Value(); },
2040  *         direction: { 1: function() {return dir.Value(); } },
2041  *         curl: { 0: function() {return curl.Value(); },
2042  *                 3: function() {return curl.Value(); }
2043  *             },
2044  *         isClosed: false
2045  *     };
2046  *
2047  *     // Plot a metapost curve
2048  *     var cu = board.create('metapostspline', [po, controls], {strokeColor: 'blue', strokeWidth: 2});
2049  *
2050  *
2051  * </pre><div id="JXGb8c6ffed-7419-41a3-9e55-3754b2327ae9" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
2052  * <script type="text/javascript">
2053  *     (function() {
2054  *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXGb8c6ffed-7419-41a3-9e55-3754b2327ae9',
2055  *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
2056  *         var po = [],
2057  *             attr = {
2058  *                 size: 5,
2059  *                 color: 'red'
2060  *             },
2061  *             controls;
2062  *
2063  *         var tension = board.create('slider', [[-3, 6], [3, 6], [0, 1, 20]], {name: 'tension'});
2064  *         var curl = board.create('slider', [[-3, 5], [3, 5], [0, 1, 30]], {name: 'curl A, D'});
2065  *         var dir = board.create('slider', [[-3, 4], [3, 4], [-180, 0, 180]], {name: 'direction B'});
2066  *
2067  *         po.push(board.create('point', [-3, -3]));
2068  *         po.push(board.create('point', [0, -3]));
2069  *         po.push(board.create('point', [4, -5]));
2070  *         po.push(board.create('point', [6, -2]));
2071  *
2072  *         var controls = {
2073  *             tension: function() {return tension.Value(); },
2074  *             direction: { 1: function() {return dir.Value(); } },
2075  *             curl: { 0: function() {return curl.Value(); },
2076  *                     3: function() {return curl.Value(); }
2077  *                 },
2078  *             isClosed: false
2079  *         };
2080  *
2081  *         // Plot a metapost curve
2082  *         var cu = board.create('metapostspline', [po, controls], {strokeColor: 'blue', strokeWidth: 2});
2083  *
2084  *
2085  *     })();
2086  *
2087  * </script><pre>
2088  *
2089  */
2090 JXG.createMetapostSpline = function (board, parents, attributes) {
2091     var el,
2092         getPointLike,
2093         points,
2094         controls,
2095         p,
2096         q,
2097         i,
2098         le,
2099         errStr = "\nPossible parent types: [points:array, controls:object";
2100 
2101     if (!Type.exists(parents[0]) || !Type.isArray(parents[0])) {
2102         throw new Error(
2103             "JSXGraph: JXG.createMetapostSpline: argument 1 'points' has to be array of points or coordinate pairs" +
2104                 errStr
2105         );
2106     }
2107     if (!Type.exists(parents[1]) || !Type.isObject(parents[1])) {
2108         throw new Error(
2109             "JSXGraph: JXG.createMetapostSpline: argument 2 'controls' has to be a JavaScript object'" +
2110                 errStr
2111         );
2112     }
2113 
2114     attributes = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, "curve");
2115     attributes = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, "metapostspline");
2116     attributes.curvetype = "parameter";
2117 
2118     p = parents[0];
2119     q = [];
2120 
2121     // given as [x[], y[]]
2122     if (
2123         !attributes.isarrayofcoordinates &&
2124         p.length === 2 &&
2125         Type.isArray(p[0]) &&
2126         Type.isArray(p[1]) &&
2127         p[0].length === p[1].length
2128     ) {
2129         for (i = 0; i < p[0].length; i++) {
2130             q[i] = [];
2131             if (Type.isFunction(p[0][i])) {
2132                 q[i].push(p[0][i]());
2133             } else {
2134                 q[i].push(p[0][i]);
2135             }
2136 
2137             if (Type.isFunction(p[1][i])) {
2138                 q[i].push(p[1][i]());
2139             } else {
2140                 q[i].push(p[1][i]);
2141             }
2142         }
2143     } else {
2144         // given as [[x0, y0], [x1, y1], point, ...]
2145         for (i = 0; i < p.length; i++) {
2146             if (Type.isString(p[i])) {
2147                 q.push(board.select(p[i]));
2148             } else if (Type.isPoint(p[i])) {
2149                 q.push(p[i]);
2150                 // given as [[x0,y0], [x1, y2], ...]
2151             } else if (Type.isArray(p[i]) && p[i].length === 2) {
2152                 q[i] = [];
2153                 if (Type.isFunction(p[i][0])) {
2154                     q[i].push(p[i][0]());
2155                 } else {
2156                     q[i].push(p[i][0]);
2157                 }
2158 
2159                 if (Type.isFunction(p[i][1])) {
2160                     q[i].push(p[i][1]());
2161                 } else {
2162                     q[i].push(p[i][1]);
2163                 }
2164             } else if (Type.isFunction(p[i]) && p[i]().length === 2) {
2165                 q.push(parents[i]());
2166             }
2167         }
2168     }
2169 
2170     if (attributes.createpoints === true) {
2171         points = Type.providePoints(board, q, attributes, 'metapostspline', ['points']);
2172     } else {
2173         points = [];
2174 
2175         /**
2176          * @ignore
2177          */
2178         getPointLike = function (ii) {
2179             return {
2180                 X: function () {
2181                     return q[ii][0];
2182                 },
2183                 Y: function () {
2184                     return q[ii][1];
2185                 }
2186             };
2187         };
2188 
2189         for (i = 0; i < q.length; i++) {
2190             if (Type.isPoint(q[i])) {
2191                 points.push(q[i]);
2192             } else {
2193                 points.push(getPointLike);
2194             }
2195         }
2196     }
2197 
2198     controls = parents[1];
2199 
2200     el = new JXG.Curve(board, ["t", [], [], 0, p.length - 1], attributes);
2201     el.updateDataArray = function () {
2202         var res,
2203             i,
2204             len = points.length,
2205             p = [];
2206 
2207         for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
2208             p.push([points[i].X(), points[i].Y()]);
2209         }
2210 
2211         res = JXG.Math.Metapost.curve(p, controls);
2212         this.dataX = res[0];
2213         this.dataY = res[1];
2214     };
2215     el.bezierDegree = 3;
2216 
2217     le = points.length;
2218     el.setParents(points);
2219     for (i = 0; i < le; i++) {
2220         if (Type.isPoint(points[i])) {
2221             points[i].addChild(el);
2222         }
2223     }
2224     el.elType = "metapostspline";
2225 
2226     return el;
2227 };

2229 JXG.registerElement("metapostspline", JXG.createMetapostSpline);
2230 
2231 /**
2232  * @class This element is used to provide a constructor for Riemann sums, which is realized as a special curve.
2233  * The returned element has the method Value() which returns the sum of the areas of the bars.
2234  * <p>
2235  * In case of type "simpson" and "trapezoidal", the horizontal line approximating the function value 
2236  * is replaced by a parabola or a secant. IN case of "simpson", 
2237  * the parabola is approximated visually by a polygonal chain of fixed step width. 
2238  * 
2239  * @pseudo
2240  * @description
2241  * @name Riemannsum
2242  * @augments JXG.Curve
2243  * @constructor
2244  * @type JXG.Curve
2245  * @param {function,array_number,function_string,function_function,number_function,number} f,n,type_,a_,b_ Parent elements of Riemannsum are a
2246  *         Either a function term f(x) describing the function graph which is filled by the Riemann bars, or
2247  *         an array consisting of two functions and the area between is filled by the Riemann bars.
2248  *         <p>
2249  *         n determines the number of bars, it is either a fixed number or a function.
2250  *         <p>
2251  *         type is a string or function returning one of the values:  'left', 'right', 'middle', 'lower', 'upper', 'random', 'simpson', or 'trapezoidal'.
2252  *         Default value is 'left'. "simpson" is Simpson's 1/3 rule.
2253  *         <p>
2254  *         Further parameters are an optional number or function for the left interval border a,
2255  *         and an optional number or function for the right interval border b.
2256  *         <p>
2257  *         Default values are a=-10 and b=10.
2258  * @see JXG.Curve
2259  * @example
2260  * // Create Riemann sums for f(x) = 0.5*x*x-2*x.
2261  *   var s = board.create('slider',[[0,4],[3,4],[0,4,10]],{snapWidth:1});
2262  *   var f = function(x) { return 0.5*x*x-2*x; };
2263  *   var r = board.create('riemannsum',
2264  *               [f, function(){return s.Value();}, 'upper', -2, 5],
2265  *               {fillOpacity:0.4}
2266  *               );
2267  *   var g = board.create('functiongraph',[f, -2, 5]);
2268  *   var t = board.create('text',[-2,-2, function(){ return 'Sum=' + JXG.toFixed(r.Value(), 4); }]);
2269  * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="JXG940f40cc-2015-420d-9191-c5d83de988cf" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
2270  * <script type="text/javascript">
2271  * (function(){
2272  *   var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXG940f40cc-2015-420d-9191-c5d83de988cf', {boundingbox: [-3, 7, 5, -3], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
2273  *   var f = function(x) { return 0.5*x*x-2*x; };
2274  *   var s = board.create('slider',[[0,4],[3,4],[0,4,10]],{snapWidth:1});
2275  *   var r = board.create('riemannsum', [f, function(){return s.Value();}, 'upper', -2, 5], {fillOpacity:0.4});
2276  *   var g = board.create('functiongraph', [f, -2, 5]);
2277  *   var t = board.create('text',[-2,-2, function(){ return 'Sum=' + JXG.toFixed(r.Value(), 4); }]);
2278  * })();
2279  * </script><pre>
2280  *
2281  * @example
2282  *   // Riemann sum between two functions
2283  *   var s = board.create('slider',[[0,4],[3,4],[0,4,10]],{snapWidth:1});
2284  *   var g = function(x) { return 0.5*x*x-2*x; };
2285  *   var f = function(x) { return -x*(x-4); };
2286  *   var r = board.create('riemannsum',
2287  *               [[g,f], function(){return s.Value();}, 'lower', 0, 4],
2288  *               {fillOpacity:0.4}
2289  *               );
2290  *   var f = board.create('functiongraph',[f, -2, 5]);
2291  *   var g = board.create('functiongraph',[g, -2, 5]);
2292  *   var t = board.create('text',[-2,-2, function(){ return 'Sum=' + JXG.toFixed(r.Value(), 4); }]);
2293  * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="JXGf9a7ba38-b50f-4a32-a873-2f3bf9caee79" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
2294  * <script type="text/javascript">
2295  * (function(){
2296  *   var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXGf9a7ba38-b50f-4a32-a873-2f3bf9caee79', {boundingbox: [-3, 7, 5, -3], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
2297  *   var s = board.create('slider',[[0,4],[3,4],[0,4,10]],{snapWidth:1});
2298  *   var g = function(x) { return 0.5*x*x-2*x; };
2299  *   var f = function(x) { return -x*(x-4); };
2300  *   var r = board.create('riemannsum',
2301  *               [[g,f], function(){return s.Value();}, 'lower', 0, 4],
2302  *               {fillOpacity:0.4}
2303  *               );
2304  *   var f = board.create('functiongraph',[f, -2, 5]);
2305  *   var g = board.create('functiongraph',[g, -2, 5]);
2306  *   var t = board.create('text',[-2,-2, function(){ return 'Sum=' + JXG.toFixed(r.Value(), 4); }]);
2307  * })();
2308  * </script><pre>
2309  */
2310 JXG.createRiemannsum = function (board, parents, attributes) {
2311     var n, type, f, par, c, attr;
2312 
2313     attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, "riemannsum");
2314     attr.curvetype = "plot";
2315 
2316     f = parents[0];
2317     n = Type.createFunction(parents[1], board, "");
2318 
2319     if (!Type.exists(n)) {
2320         throw new Error(
2321             "JSXGraph: JXG.createRiemannsum: argument '2' n has to be number or function." +
2322                 "\nPossible parent types: [function,n:number|function,type,start:number|function,end:number|function]"
2323         );
2324     }
2325 
2326     type = Type.createFunction(parents[2], board, "", false);
2327     if (!Type.exists(type)) {
2328         throw new Error(
2329             "JSXGraph: JXG.createRiemannsum: argument 3 'type' has to be string or function." +
2330                 "\nPossible parent types: [function,n:number|function,type,start:number|function,end:number|function]"
2331         );
2332     }
2333 
2334     par = [[0], [0]].concat(parents.slice(3));
2335 
2336     c = board.create("curve", par, attr);
2337 
2338     c.sum = 0.0;
2339     /**
2340      * Returns the value of the Riemann sum, i.e. the sum of the (signed) areas of the rectangles.
2341      * @name Value
2342      * @memberOf Riemann.prototype
2343      * @function
2344      * @returns {Number} value of Riemann sum.
2345      */
2346     c.Value = function () {
2347         return this.sum;
2348     };
2349 
2350     /**
2351      * @ignore
2352      */
2353     c.updateDataArray = function () {
2354         var u = Numerics.riemann(f, n(), type(), this.minX(), this.maxX());
2355         this.dataX = u[0];
2356         this.dataY = u[1];
2357 
2358         // Update "Riemann sum"
2359         this.sum = u[2];
2360     };
2361 
2362     c.addParentsFromJCFunctions([n, type]);
2363 
2364     return c;
2365 };
2366 
2367 JXG.registerElement("riemannsum", JXG.createRiemannsum);
2368 
2369 /**
2370  * @class This element is used to provide a constructor for trace curve (simple locus curve), which is realized as a special curve.
2371  * @pseudo
2372  * @description
2373  * @name Tracecurve
2374  * @augments JXG.Curve
2375  * @constructor
2376  * @type JXG.Curve
2377  * @param {Point,Point} Parent elements of Tracecurve are a
2378  *         glider point and a point whose locus is traced.
2379  * @see JXG.Curve
2380  * @example
2381  * // Create trace curve.
2382  * var c1 = board.create('circle',[[0, 0], [2, 0]]),
2383  * p1 = board.create('point',[-3, 1]),
2384  * g1 = board.create('glider',[2, 1, c1]),
2385  * s1 = board.create('segment',[g1, p1]),
2386  * p2 = board.create('midpoint',[s1]),
2387  * curve = board.create('tracecurve', [g1, p2]);
2388  *
2389  * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="JXG5749fb7d-04fc-44d2-973e-45c1951e29ad" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
2390  * <script type="text/javascript">
2391  *   var tc1_board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXG5749fb7d-04fc-44d2-973e-45c1951e29ad', {boundingbox: [-4, 4, 4, -4], axis: false, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
2392  *   var c1 = tc1_board.create('circle',[[0, 0], [2, 0]]),
2393  *       p1 = tc1_board.create('point',[-3, 1]),
2394  *       g1 = tc1_board.create('glider',[2, 1, c1]),
2395  *       s1 = tc1_board.create('segment',[g1, p1]),
2396  *       p2 = tc1_board.create('midpoint',[s1]),
2397  *       curve = tc1_board.create('tracecurve', [g1, p2]);
2398  * </script><pre>
2399  */
2400 JXG.createTracecurve = function (board, parents, attributes) {
2401     var c, glider, tracepoint, attr;
2402 
2403     if (parents.length !== 2) {
2404         throw new Error(
2405             "JSXGraph: Can't create trace curve with given parent'" +
2406                 "\nPossible parent types: [glider, point]"
2407         );
2408     }
2409 
2410     glider = board.select(parents[0]);
2411     tracepoint = board.select(parents[1]);
2412 
2413     if (glider.type !== Const.OBJECT_TYPE_GLIDER || !Type.isPoint(tracepoint)) {
2414         throw new Error(
2415             "JSXGraph: Can't create trace curve with parent types '" +
2416                 typeof parents[0] +
2417                 "' and '" +
2418                 typeof parents[1] +
2419                 "'." +
2420                 "\nPossible parent types: [glider, point]"
2421         );
2422     }
2423 
2424     attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, "tracecurve");
2425     attr.curvetype = "plot";
2426     c = board.create("curve", [[0], [0]], attr);
2427 
2428     /**
2429      * @ignore
2430      */
2431     c.updateDataArray = function () {
2432         var i,
2433             step,
2434             t,
2435             el,
2436             pEl,
2437             x,
2438             y,
2439             from,
2440             savetrace,
2441             le = attr.numberpoints,
2442             savePos = glider.position,
2443             slideObj = glider.slideObject,
2444             mi = slideObj.minX(),
2445             ma = slideObj.maxX();
2446 
2447         // set step width
2448         step = (ma - mi) / le;
2449         this.dataX = [];
2450         this.dataY = [];
2451 
2452         /*
2453          * For gliders on circles and lines a closed curve is computed.
2454          * For gliders on curves the curve is not closed.
2455          */
2456         if (slideObj.elementClass !== Const.OBJECT_CLASS_CURVE) {
2457             le++;
2458         }
2459 
2460         // Loop over all steps
2461         for (i = 0; i < le; i++) {
2462             t = mi + i * step;
2463             x = slideObj.X(t) / slideObj.Z(t);
2464             y = slideObj.Y(t) / slideObj.Z(t);
2465 
2466             // Position the glider
2467             glider.setPositionDirectly(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [x, y]);
2468             from = false;
2469 
2470             // Update all elements from the glider up to the trace element
2471             for (el in this.board.objects) {
2472                 if (this.board.objects.hasOwnProperty(el)) {
2473                     pEl = this.board.objects[el];
2474 
2475                     if (pEl === glider) {
2476                         from = true;
2477                     }
2478 
2479                     if (from && pEl.needsRegularUpdate) {
2480                         // Save the trace mode of the element
2481                         savetrace = pEl.visProp.trace;
2482                         pEl.visProp.trace = false;
2483                         pEl.needsUpdate = true;
2484                         pEl.update(true);
2485 
2486                         // Restore the trace mode
2487                         pEl.visProp.trace = savetrace;
2488                         if (pEl === tracepoint) {
2489                             break;
2490                         }
2491                     }
2492                 }
2493             }
2494 
2495             // Store the position of the trace point
2496             this.dataX[i] = tracepoint.X();
2497             this.dataY[i] = tracepoint.Y();
2498         }
2499 
2500         // Restore the original position of the glider
2501         glider.position = savePos;
2502         from = false;
2503 
2504         // Update all elements from the glider to the trace point
2505         for (el in this.board.objects) {
2506             if (this.board.objects.hasOwnProperty(el)) {
2507                 pEl = this.board.objects[el];
2508                 if (pEl === glider) {
2509                     from = true;
2510                 }
2511 
2512                 if (from && pEl.needsRegularUpdate) {
2513                     savetrace = pEl.visProp.trace;
2514                     pEl.visProp.trace = false;
2515                     pEl.needsUpdate = true;
2516                     pEl.update(true);
2517                     pEl.visProp.trace = savetrace;
2518 
2519                     if (pEl === tracepoint) {
2520                         break;
2521                     }
2522                 }
2523             }
2524         }
2525     };
2526 
2527     return c;
2528 };
2529 
2530 JXG.registerElement("tracecurve", JXG.createTracecurve);
2531 
2532 /**
2533      * @class This element is used to provide a constructor for step function, which is realized as a special curve.
2534      *
2535      * In case the data points should be updated after creation time, they can be accessed by curve.xterm and curve.yterm.
2536      * @pseudo
2537      * @description
2538      * @name Stepfunction
2539      * @augments JXG.Curve
2540      * @constructor
2541      * @type JXG.Curve
2542      * @param {Array,Array|Function} Parent elements of Stepfunction are two arrays containing the coordinates.
2543      * @see JXG.Curve
2544      * @example
2545      * // Create step function.
2546      var curve = board.create('stepfunction', [[0,1,2,3,4,5], [1,3,0,2,2,1]]);
2547 
2548      * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="JXG32342ec9-ad17-4339-8a97-ff23dc34f51a" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
2549      * <script type="text/javascript">
2550      *   var sf1_board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXG32342ec9-ad17-4339-8a97-ff23dc34f51a', {boundingbox: [-1, 5, 6, -2], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
2551      *   var curve = sf1_board.create('stepfunction', [[0,1,2,3,4,5], [1,3,0,2,2,1]]);
2552      * </script><pre>
2553      */
2554 JXG.createStepfunction = function (board, parents, attributes) {
2555     var c, attr;
2556     if (parents.length !== 2) {
2557         throw new Error(
2558             "JSXGraph: Can't create step function with given parent'" +
2559                 "\nPossible parent types: [array, array|function]"
2560         );
2561     }
2562 
2563     attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, "stepfunction");
2564     c = board.create("curve", parents, attr);
2565     /**
2566      * @ignore
2567      */
2568     c.updateDataArray = function () {
2569         var i,
2570             j = 0,
2571             len = this.xterm.length;
2572 
2573         this.dataX = [];
2574         this.dataY = [];
2575 
2576         if (len === 0) {
2577             return;
2578         }
2579 
2580         this.dataX[j] = this.xterm[0];
2581         this.dataY[j] = this.yterm[0];
2582         ++j;
2583 
2584         for (i = 1; i < len; ++i) {
2585             this.dataX[j] = this.xterm[i];
2586             this.dataY[j] = this.dataY[j - 1];
2587             ++j;
2588             this.dataX[j] = this.xterm[i];
2589             this.dataY[j] = this.yterm[i];
2590             ++j;
2591         }
2592     };
2593 
2594     return c;
2595 };
2596 
2597 JXG.registerElement("stepfunction", JXG.createStepfunction);
2598 
2599 /**
2600  * @class This element is used to provide a constructor for the graph showing
2601  * the (numerical) derivative of a given curve.
2602  *
2603  * @pseudo
2604  * @description
2605  * @name Derivative
2606  * @augments JXG.Curve
2607  * @constructor
2608  * @type JXG.Curve
2609  * @param {JXG.Curve} Parent Curve for which the derivative is generated.
2610  * @see JXG.Curve
2611  * @example
2612  * var cu = board.create('cardinalspline', [[[-3,0], [-1,2], [0,1], [2,0], [3,1]], 0.5, 'centripetal'], {createPoints: false});
2613  * var d = board.create('derivative', [cu], {dash: 2});
2614  *
2615  * </pre><div id="JXGb9600738-1656-11e8-8184-901b0e1b8723" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
2616  * <script type="text/javascript">
2617  *     (function() {
2618  *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXGb9600738-1656-11e8-8184-901b0e1b8723',
2619  *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
2620  *     var cu = board.create('cardinalspline', [[[-3,0], [-1,2], [0,1], [2,0], [3,1]], 0.5, 'centripetal'], {createPoints: false});
2621  *     var d = board.create('derivative', [cu], {dash: 2});
2622  *
2623  *     })();
2624  *
2625  * </script><pre>
2626  *
2627  */
2628 JXG.createDerivative = function (board, parents, attributes) {
2629     var c, curve, dx, dy, attr;
2630 
2631     if (parents.length !== 1 && parents[0].class !== Const.OBJECT_CLASS_CURVE) {
2632         throw new Error(
2633             "JSXGraph: Can't create derivative curve with given parent'" +
2634                 "\nPossible parent types: [curve]"
2635         );
2636     }
2637 
2638     attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, "curve");
2639 
2640     curve = parents[0];
2641     dx = Numerics.D(curve.X);
2642     dy = Numerics.D(curve.Y);
2643 
2644     c = board.create(
2645         "curve",
2646         [
2647             function (t) {
2648                 return curve.X(t);
2649             },
2650             function (t) {
2651                 return dy(t) / dx(t);
2652             },
2653             curve.minX(),
2654             curve.maxX()
2655         ],
2656         attr
2657     );
2658 
2659     c.setParents(curve);
2660 
2661     return c;
2662 };
2663 
2664 JXG.registerElement("derivative", JXG.createDerivative);
2665 
2666 /**
2667  * @class Intersection of two closed path elements. The elements may be of type curve, circle, polygon, inequality.
2668  * If one element is a curve, it has to be closed.
2669  * The resulting element is of type curve.
2670  * @pseudo
2671  * @description
2672  * @name CurveIntersection
2673  * @param {JXG.Curve|JXG.Polygon|JXG.Circle} curve1 First element which is intersected
2674  * @param {JXG.Curve|JXG.Polygon|JXG.Circle} curve2 Second element which is intersected
2675  * @augments JXG.Curve
2676  * @constructor
2677  * @type JXG.Curve
2678  *
2679  * @example
2680  * var f = board.create('functiongraph', ['cos(x)']);
2681  * var ineq = board.create('inequality', [f], {inverse: true, fillOpacity: 0.1});
2682  * var circ = board.create('circle', [[0,0], 4]);
2683  * var clip = board.create('curveintersection', [ineq, circ], {fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.6});
2684  *
2685  * </pre><div id="JXGe2948257-8835-4276-9164-8acccb48e8d4" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
2686  * <script type="text/javascript">
2687  *     (function() {
2688  *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXGe2948257-8835-4276-9164-8acccb48e8d4',
2689  *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
2690  *     var f = board.create('functiongraph', ['cos(x)']);
2691  *     var ineq = board.create('inequality', [f], {inverse: true, fillOpacity: 0.1});
2692  *     var circ = board.create('circle', [[0,0], 4]);
2693  *     var clip = board.create('curveintersection', [ineq, circ], {fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.6});
2694  *
2695  *     })();
2696  *
2697  * </script><pre>
2698  *
2699  */
2700 JXG.createCurveIntersection = function (board, parents, attributes) {
2701     var c;
2702 
2703     if (parents.length !== 2) {
2704         throw new Error(
2705             "JSXGraph: Can't create curve intersection with given parent'" +
2706                 "\nPossible parent types: [array, array|function]"
2707         );
2708     }
2709 
2710     c = board.create("curve", [[], []], attributes);
2711     /**
2712      * @ignore
2713      */
2714     c.updateDataArray = function () {
2715         var a = JXG.Math.Clip.intersection(parents[0], parents[1], this.board);
2716         this.dataX = a[0];
2717         this.dataY = a[1];
2718     };
2719     return c;
2720 };

2799  *     (function() {
2800  *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXGe2948257-8835-4276-9164-8acccb48e8d4',
2801  *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
2802  *     var f = board.create('functiongraph', ['cos(x)']);
2803  *     var ineq = board.create('inequality', [f], {inverse: true, fillOpacity: 0.1});
2804  *     var circ = board.create('circle', [[0,0], 4]);
2805  *     var clip = board.create('curvedifference', [ineq, circ], {fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.6});
2806  *
2807  *     })();
2808  *
2809  * </script><pre>
2810  *
2811  */
2812 JXG.createCurveDifference = function (board, parents, attributes) {
2813     var c;

2816         throw new Error(
2817             "JSXGraph: Can't create curve difference with given parent'" +
2818                 "\nPossible parent types: [array, array|function]"
2819         );
2820     }
2821 
2822     c = board.create("curve", [[], []], attributes);
2823     /**
2824      * @ignore
2825      */
2826     c.updateDataArray = function () {
2827         var a = JXG.Math.Clip.difference(parents[0], parents[1], this.board);
2828         this.dataX = a[0];
2829         this.dataY = a[1];
2830     };
2831     return c;

2838 /**
2839  * @class Box plot curve. The direction of the box plot can be either vertical or horizontal which
2840  * is controlled by the attribute "dir".
2841  * @pseudo
2842  * @description
2843  * @name Boxplot
2844  * @param {Array} quantiles Array conatining at least five quantiles. The elements can be of type number, function or string.
2845  * @param {Number|Function} axis Axis position of the box plot
2846  * @param {Number|Function} width Width of the rectangle part of the box plot. The width of the first and 4th quantile
2847  * is relative to this width and can be controlled by the attribute "smallWidth".
2848  * @augments JXG.Curve
2849  * @constructor
2850  * @type JXG.Curve
2851  *
2852  * @example
2853  * var Q = [ -1, 2, 3, 3.5, 5 ];
2854  *
2855  * var b = board.create('boxplot', [Q, 2, 4], {strokeWidth: 3});
2856  *
2857  * </pre><div id="JXG13eb23a1-a641-41a2-be11-8e03e400a947" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
2858  * <script type="text/javascript">
2859  *     (function() {
2860  *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXG13eb23a1-a641-41a2-be11-8e03e400a947',
2861  *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
2862  *     var Q = [ -1, 2, 3, 3.5, 5 ];
2863  *     var b = board.create('boxplot', [Q, 2, 4], {strokeWidth: 3});
2864  *
2865  *     })();
2866  *
2867  * </script><pre>
2868  *
2869  * @example
2870  * var Q = [ -1, 2, 3, 3.5, 5 ];
2871  * var b = board.create('boxplot', [Q, 3, 4], {dir: 'horizontal', smallWidth: 0.25, color:'red'});
2872  *
2873  * </pre><div id="JXG0deb9cb2-84bc-470d-a6db-8be9a5694813" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
2874  * <script type="text/javascript">
2875  *     (function() {
2876  *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXG0deb9cb2-84bc-470d-a6db-8be9a5694813',
2877  *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
2878  *     var Q = [ -1, 2, 3, 3.5, 5 ];
2879  *     var b = board.create('boxplot', [Q, 3, 4], {dir: 'horizontal', smallWidth: 0.25, color:'red'});
2880  *
2881  *     })();
2882  *
2883  * </script><pre>
2884  *
2885  * @example
2886  * var data = [57, 57, 57, 58, 63, 66, 66, 67, 67, 68, 69, 70, 70, 70, 70, 72, 73, 75, 75, 76, 76, 78, 79, 81];
2887  * var Q = [];
2888  *
2889  * Q[0] = JXG.Math.Statistics.min(data);
2890  * Q = Q.concat(JXG.Math.Statistics.percentile(data, [25, 50, 75]));
2891  * Q[4] = JXG.Math.Statistics.max(data);
2892  *

2899  *             {boundingbox: [-5,90,5,30], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
2900  *     var data = [57, 57, 57, 58, 63, 66, 66, 67, 67, 68, 69, 70, 70, 70, 70, 72, 73, 75, 75, 76, 76, 78, 79, 81];

2928  *

2930  *
2931  *     })();
2932  *
2933  * </script><pre>
2934  *
2935  */
2936 JXG.createBoxPlot = function (board, parents, attributes) {
2937     var box, i, len, w2,
2938         attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, "boxplot");
2939 
2940     if (parents.length !== 3) {
2941         throw new Error(
2942             "JSXGraph: Can't create box plot with given parent'" +
2943                 "\nPossible parent types: [array, number|function, number|function] containing quantiles, axis, width"
2944         );
2945     }
2946     if (parents[0].length < 5) {
2947         throw new Error(
2948             "JSXGraph: Can't create box plot with given parent[0]'" +
2949                 "\nparent[0] has to conatin at least 5 quantiles."
2950         );
2951     }
2952     box = board.create("curve", [[], []], attr);
2953 
2954     len = parents[0].length; // Quantiles
2955     box.Q = [];
2956     for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
2957         box.Q[i] = Type.createFunction(parents[0][i], board, null, true);
2958     }
2959     box.x = Type.createFunction(parents[1], board, null, true);
2960     box.w = Type.createFunction(parents[2], board, null, true);
2961 
2962     box.updateDataArray = function () {
2963         var v1, v2, l1, l2, r1, r2, w2, dir, x;
2964 
2965         w2 = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.smallwidth);
2966         dir = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.dir);
2967         x = this.x();
2968         l1 = x - this.w() * 0.5;
2969         l2 = x - this.w() * 0.5 * w2;
2970         r1 = x + this.w() * 0.5;
2971         r2 = x + this.w() * 0.5 * w2;
2972         v1 = [x, l2, r2, x, x, l1, l1, r1, r1, x, NaN, l1, r1, NaN, x, x, l2, r2, x];
2973         v2 = [
2974             this.Q[0](),
2975             this.Q[0](),
2976             this.Q[0](),
2977             this.Q[0](),
2978             this.Q[1](),
2979             this.Q[1](),
2980             this.Q[3](),
2981             this.Q[3](),
2982             this.Q[1](),
2983             this.Q[1](),
2984             NaN,
2985             this.Q[2](),
2986             this.Q[2](),
2987             NaN,
2988             this.Q[3](),
2989             this.Q[4](),
2990             this.Q[4](),
2991             this.Q[4](),
2992             this.Q[4]()
2993         ];
2994         if (dir === "vertical") {
2995             this.dataX = v1;
2996             this.dataY = v2;
2997         } else {
2998             this.dataX = v2;
2999             this.dataY = v1;
3000         }
3001     };
3002 
3003     box.addParentsFromJCFunctions([box.Q, box.x, box.w]);
3004 
3005     return box;
3006 };
3007 
3008 JXG.registerElement("boxplot", JXG.createBoxPlot);
3009 
3010 export default JXG.Curve;
